title: Half Marathon Houston - Runna Week 10
description:
We are now in the home stretch for my preparation for the half marathon at Houston, and I’ll be hitting peak mileage weeks, just in time for Christmas. So let’s pack up the presents and the carbon plated racers, this is a Runna update at week 10.

0:00 intro
0:39 Disclosure
1:19 Week 9
8:45 Week 10
15:44 Predictions

disclosures: Runna is the sponsor for this training series. You can use code KOFUZI in the app for two free weeks. I get no additional benefit or penalty whether you use the code or not. No other brands have paid or requested to have their products depicted in this video

https://join.runna.com/lKmc/refer?deep_link_sub1=KOFUZI

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

Music sourced via Epidemic Sound https://www.epidemicsound.com/referral/0xronu/
---

-------
strava: https://www.strava.com/athletes/kofuzi
instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kofuzi/
threads: https://www.threads.net/@kofuzi

subscriber count at time of upload: 206,553

title: How Much a 200,000 Subscriber YouTube Channel Makes in a Year In AdRev
description:
This is my seventh time making a year end AdRev video. This is how much a 200k subscriber YouTube channel makes from AdRev in a year. Note: this is a product review channel that focuses on running shoes. 

TLDR - $59,086.51

0:00 intro
0:54 overview stats
2:08 most viewed videos
4:37 Videos vs Shorts
5:41 how viewers find me
6:42 subscriber increase rate is down
8:00 age and gender
9:14 highest earning videos
11:58 my worst earning video

How Much a 10,000 Subscriber Channel Makes https://youtu.be/Ng-gOPzwhMQ?si=w2Am5NcM7HZcFUsZ
How Much a 30,000 Subscriber Channel Makes https://youtu.be/ygIHPpikZ1M?si=G6SamTvq0ZfPR864
How Much a 60,000 Subscriber Channel Makes https://youtu.be/mZXLMYtb5Og?si=nZclQT_LUi_Ijwpo
How Much a 90,000 Subscriber Channel Makes https://youtu.be/tssOBD26I1M?si=Ey0rdx4C5F6drdmJ
How Much a 120,000 Subscriber Channel Makes https://youtu.be/QfkUM4hBge8?si=LBXTukCAVYL5VmW7
How Much a 169,000 Subscriber Channel Makes https://youtu.be/JeP9LFTcZao?si=h8f7FSJd25kRNTfm

.

Best Max Cushion: Brooks Glycerin Max

.

title: Best of 2024. Long Run
description:
A new subgenre emerges. Brands have been making shoes with max stack but minimal (relatively speaking) weight. They been doing this by reducing the amount of plush memory foams normally seen in the max cushion category and replacing thick slabs of EVA with racing materials. The result is a shoe that is a dream for those long runs where might have a few chunks at marathon effort. These are my favorites released in 2024
.
5. Mizuno Neo Vista
4. New Balance Balos
3. Topo Specter 2
2. New Balance SC Trainer v2
1. ASICS Superblast 2
.
Disclosures: all of these shoes were provided by their respective manufacturers for the purpose of review. No one is paying me to make this video or to include their shoe on this list. No brands are tagged and no hashtags are being used

title: Half Marathon Houston - Runna Week 8

We are now in the thick of it for my preparation for the half marathon at Houston. And after week 6, some people were concerned that this plan might break me. Now that two more weeks have passed, let’s see how I’m holding up. This is a Runna update at week 8. 

0:00 intro
1:09 week 7
5:30 Strength, Mobility
8:53 week 8
16:35 yoga

disclosures: Runna is the sponsor for this training series. You can use code KOFUZI in the app for two free weeks. I get no additional benefit or penalty whether you use the code or not. 

https://join.runna.com/lKmc/refer?deep_link_sub1=KOFUZI

subscriber count at time of upload: 204,657

end card music:
Jim Yosef - Checkered
https://soundcloud.com/ninety9live/jim-yosef-checkered

title: Best of 2024. Long Run
description:
I’m creating a new category to reflect a shift I’m seeing in max cushion shoes. While there are traditional max cushion shoes that we look to for plush easy days and relaxed recovery runs, there are some max cushion shoes that forgo the excess padding and use race caliber foams to deliver an experience that is both comfy and quick. Shoes like the Superblast, Invincible, and Cloud Eclipse have led the way in this new subgenre, and in 2024, it felt weird to keep ranking these shoes against the likes of the Bondi or Glycerin. So this year, I’m ranking my Top 5 Best Long Run Shoes of 2024. 

0:00 intro
1:46 Disclosures
2:06 Mizuno Neo Vista
3:08 New Balance Balos
4:23 Topo Specter 2
5:18 New Balance SC Trainer v3
6:12 ASICS Superblast 2

disclosures: all the shoes in this video were provided by their respective manufacturer for the purpose of review during the normal course of the year. No one is paying me to make this video or to include their shoe on this list. No one previewed the list of my footage before it went up on YouTube. 

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

subscriber count at time of upload: 204,473

end card music:
Jim Yosef - Checkered
https://soundcloud.com/ninety9live/jim-yosef-checkered

title: Best of 2024. Racing.
description:
Olympic years bring out the best in pinnacle product. 2024 was incredible. Here are my favorite carbon plated racers for marathon training and racing that were released in 2024
.
5. Hoka Cielo X1
4. Puma Fast R2
3. Alphafly 3
2. ASICS MetaSpeed Sky Paris
1. Puma Nitro Elite 3
.
Disclosures: no one is paying me to make this video or to include their shoe on this list. No one previewed the list or this edit before it was published. I bought the AF3 myself. The remaining shoes were provided by their respective manufacturers. No brands are tagged, no hashtags are being used.

title: Best Marathon Racing Shoes of 2024
description:
With the year coming to a close, let’s take a look back at the best carbon plated racers that hit the market over the last 12 months. These are my Top 5 marathon racing shoes of 2024. 

0:00 intro
0:51 disclosures
1:10 Cielo X1
2:30 Fast R2
3:58 AF3
5:23 Metaspeed Sky Paris
6:47 Nitro Elite 3
8:11 honorable mention

disclosures: I bought the AF3. The remaining shoes were provided by their respective manufacturers. No one is paying me to make this video or to include their shoe on this list. No one previewed this edit or my thoughts before the video went up on YouTube.

title: Best Daily Trainers 2024
description:
Amen for light squishy bouncy daily trainers. 2024 brought a lot of happy miles in my Top 5 Daily Trainers
.
5. Adidas Adizero SL2
4. Hoka Mach 6
3. Nike Pegasus Plus
2. ASICS Novablast 5
1. New Balance Rebel v4
.
Watch my YouTube video for my fully explanations and also to see which shoe got honorable mention 
.
Disclosures: I bought the Peg Plus. The remaining shoes were sent to me by their respective manufacturers. No one paid me to make this video or to include their brand in this video. No one previewed my footage or thoughts before the video went up on YouTube. No brands are tagged. No hashtags are being used.

title: New Balance 1080v14
description:
A solid update from one of my favorite models. The 1080 retains so much of that daily training fun and lightness, although the update does bring a bit more stability. It seems like there’s just a bit more foam along the outer edge of the shoe in both the forefoot and the heel. (I didn’t ask for that but not everything is about me).
I do also sense that the Fresh Foam X might be just a tiny bit more dense, but that could also just be my feet going a bit numb on this 16 mile winter run. 
.
Further testing: hopefully a warmer run with some strides 
.
Disclosures: I bought this shoe. No one paid for this video or to be included in this video. No brands are tagged in this video. 
.
Hat: Path Projects x Kofuzi Non Elite beanie. This is my merch
Jacket: New Balance. I have done public appearance work for this brand, and they gave me this jacket. 
Gloves and Pants: Craft. I have done public appearance work for this brand, but I bought these pants and gloves. 
Pack: Camelbak. I have received product from this brand, including this pack. 
Sunglasses: Blenders. I received a free pair of sunglasses from them once while at a shakeout event. I bought these particular sunglasses though (actually my second pair of these as my daughter stole my first pair)

title: New Balance More v5
description:
The More v4 was my top max cushion shoe back in 2022, and I guess it was so good that New Balance didn’t think it needed updating for almost a full two years. So was it worth the wait? Let’s lace up the More v5 and take it for a run. 

0:00 intro
0:43 Disclosures
0:59 Specs
2:31 What’s It Like
6:05 Fresh Foam X vs FuelCell9:07 New Balance Lineup
11:02 New Balance core rotation
11:44 Buying Guide
12:41 vs Bondi 8
13:50 vs Atmos

Disclosures: I bought these shoes. No one is paying me to make this video or to include their brand in this video. No one will get a chance to preview any of my footage or my thoughts before this video goes up on YouTube.   

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

Music sourced via Epidemic Sound https://www.epidemicsound.com/referral/0xronu/

instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kofuzi/

title: The Running Event TRE 2024 - A Runner's Weekend
description:
If there is a pre-season in the running shoe world, it’s The Running Event (TRE). It’s a running brand convention that showcase what’s coming up in the next year, and everyone looks like they’ve got a shot at winning. It’s also a really great time to catch up with some friends and colleagues, so let’s hop on a plane and head to Austin. This is a runner’s weekend at The Running Event 2024. 

0:00 intro
0:49 meeting with Tommie_Runz
1:52 solo miles
3:13 running with Tommie_Runz
5:57 interviewing TRE attendees
7:20 speaking at TRE
8:23 Shoe Spotting with Running Warehouse
9:36 Hoka reception
10:32 secret shoe testing
13:15 Thomas Neuberger, Believe in the Run
13:46 Diadora
14:36 Kiprun
15:36 Brooks
17:00 lunch
17:39 PR Project TRE Livestream
18:40 Tommie_Runz
18:56 Adidas
19:49 Mizuno
21:06 Under Armour
22:16 Hoka
23:32 It's Matt B
23:51 Skechers Performance
24:16 On Running
25:29 Ultra Trail Steven
25:54 ASICS
26:26 Topo
27:03 Teva Happy Hour
27:50 Megan Searfoss, Connecticut Running Company
28:05 Sam, Road Trail Run
28:13 Meghann, Featherstone Nutrition
28:19 Meaghan, Believe in the Run
28:25 Valerie, Tenis Certo
28:33 Eric, Rad Dad Bod
28:49 Ryan, Ryan's Running Reviews
28:59 Taylor, Believe in the Run
29:06 Billy Yang
29:29 Torchy's Taco Run
31:04 Rabbit
31:24 Greg Itahara
31:40 missed connections
33:03 Tracksmith
33:26 Skratch Labs
33:49 Ciele
34:17 Gu
34:42 bonus time
35:07 Puma
35:54 too tired to leave
36:25 mini-pod with Thomas
47:26 Flotrack and Brooks After Party

disclosures: I don't think I need to mark this as paid advertising as I technically do not have any obligation from anyone to include or mention anything in this video. I was paid, however, to help promote an event outside of TRE by sharing details about it on my Instagram Story and on Strava. Because that event is depicted in this video, I will mark the video as paid advertising. 

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

Music sourced via Epidemic Sound https://www.epidemicsound.com/referral/0xronu/

title: New Balance More v5
description:
First run in the More v5. This is a good example of a max cushion shoe. I think it will have broad commercial appeal. But I am a bit disappointed.
The most common question I got from my More v4 review what whether it was good for walking. And I would frequently reply that the sharp rocker makes the large midsole manageable for running but awkward for walking. It feels like the More v5’s design changes address this issue exclusively. For some, that will be great. For me, not so much. 
.
Disclosures: no one paid me to make this video or to include their brand in this video
.
Hat: Carhartt. None. 
Jacket: Bandit. I have done paid work with this brand, but I bought this particular jacket. 
Mittens: Craft. I have done unpaid public appearance work for this brand, and I’m not sure how I got these mittens. Most likely, I bought them myself. I’ve been buying Craft mittens for winter running for years
Tights: Rabbit. I have made collab merch with this brand. I’m pretty sure they sent me these tights. 
Shoes: New Balance. I have done unpaid public appearance work for this brand, but I bought these shoes myself

title: Turkey Trot. 20th OA. 2nd AG
description:
Cold temps on a hilly 5mi course for this year’s Turkey Trot. I brought my daughter with me, and she ran the 1-lap 2.5mi race. It was the coldest temps she’s ever run in, and she was happy with her performance. 
.
They give away a free turkey if you win your age group, so that was my goal. Unfortunately, the hills really got to me on this one, and I missed my AG win by 24 seconds and came in second. 20th overall also isn’t so bad, considering the amount of HS XC, college runners, and former college runners in the crowd. 
.
Disclosures: no one paid for me to run this race or to include their brand in this video. 
.
Hat: Kofuzi Path collab hat. This is my merch 
Shirt: Runna. I am currently working on a paid basis with this brand as I prepare for Houston half marathon. 
Tights: Ciele. I have received product from this brand, including the tights. 
Socks: Bandit. I have done paid work for this brand and received these socks from the brand. 
Shoes: On. I have received product from this brand, including these shoes. 
Bib: none. I bought my and my daughter’s bibs.

title: ASICS Novablast 5
description:
This year, the Novablast 5 will feature FF Blast Max, a foam that is lighter than the foam in last year’s Novablast. But with the trend of super foams making their way into daily trainers, will FF Blast Max be enough for ASICS to keep up? It’s time to lace up the Novablst 5 and take it for a run. 

0:00 intro
0:58 Disclosures
1:15 Specs
3:48 What’s It Like
6:22 ASICS Explained
9:56 Buying Guide
11:02 vs Evo SL
12:43 vs Pegasus Plus

disclosures: ASICS sent me these shoes to review, so I did not have to pay for them. However, no one is paying me to make this video or to include their shoe in this video. No one will get a chance to preview any of my footage or my thoughts before this video goes up on YouTube 

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

Running footage shot on: 
GoPro Hero 13 

Music sourced via Epidemic Sound (paid link )
https://www.epidemicsound.com/referral/0xronu/
---

strava: https://www.strava.com/athletes/kofuzi
instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kofuzi/
threads: https://www.threads.net/@kofuzi

subscriber count at time of upload: 202,211

end card music:
Jim Yosef - Checkered
https://soundcloud.com/ninety9live/jim-yosef-checkered

title: Puma Fast R2 - After 100 Miles
description:
I was skeptical when Puma first told me about their new aliphatic TPU super foam, especially when they told me that it was not only fast, but highly durable. And while the aliphatic TPU has delivered in the performance department, how is it holding up after extensive use. Let’s talk about the Fast R2 after 100 miles

0:00 intro
0:47 disclosures
1:08 How I've Been Using Them
2:41 How They've Been Holding Up
6:42 Puma Explained
10:28 Buying Guide
11:19 vs Metaspeed Sky Paris
12:09 vs Cielo X1

disclosures: Puma sent these shoes for me to review, so I did not have to pay for them. No one is paying me to make this video or to include their shoe in this video. No one will get a chance to preview any of my footage or my thoughts before this video goes up on YouTube.

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

Running footage shot on: 
GoPro Hero 13 
DJI Action 4

Music sourced via Epidemic Sound https://www.epidemicsound.com/referral/0xronu/
---

-------
strava: https://www.strava.com/athletes/kofuzi
instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kofuzi/
threads: https://www.threads.net/@kofuzi

subscriber count at time of upload: 201,902

end card music:
Jim Yosef - Checkered
https://soundcloud.com/ninety9live/jim-yosef-checkered

title: On Cloudboom Strike LS
description:
This is the Cloudboom Strike LS. The upper is made by a collection of machines that spray on an upper, cure it with UV light, and inkjet print on the color. The entire process takes three minutes, and it’s quite remarkable. But can you actually run in it? It’s time to pull on the Cloudboom Strike LS and take them for a run. 

UPDATE: I have incorrectly reported the drop as 5mm. It is 4mm. So, stack height is 40mm heel, 36mm forefoot.

0:00 intro
1:10 Disclosures
1:30 Specs
4:33 Lightspray Specs
9:15 What’s It Like
11:12 What’s the Upper Like
13:29 On Explained
17:56 Buying Guide
18:48 vs Cloudboom Strike
19:51 vs Adios Pro 3

disclosures: On provided these shoes for me to review, so I did not pay for them. No one is paying me to make this video or to include their shoe in this video. No one will get a chance to preview my footage or thoughts before the video went up on YouTube.

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

Running footage shot on: 
GoPro Hero 13

Music sourced via Epidemic Sound https://www.epidemicsound.com/referral/0xronu/


---

-------
strava: https://www.strava.com/athletes/kofuzi
instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kofuzi/
threads: https://www.threads.net/@kofuzi

subscriber count at time of upload: 201,583

end card music:
Jim Yosef - Checkered
https://soundcloud.com/ninety9live/jim-yosef-checkered

title: ASICS Novablast 5
description:
13 miles out of the box with the new Novablast 5. This year, this shoe gets a foam update to FF Blast Max. We’ve previously seen a bit of this foam in the Glideride Max which showed us a great amount a comfort without excessive squish, and I’m getting a lot of similar sensations here. Really agreeable ride. Nice sense of cushion and spring, but it’s not unstable. 
Putting it side by side with the last version, it certainly looks like there’s more foam in version 5. But this new foam is lighter, making the seemingly bigger shoe a bit lighter.
Since taking it on a first run, I’ve run a 7 mile easy day after a hard workout yesterday, and I really enjoyed the shoe. It feels like it can run forever. I’d like to get some more strides in them to get a better feel for how this shoe feels at some faster paces, but I’ve enjoyed it for some slightly fast bursts of speed so far. 
Full review will probably go up next week after another couple of runs. 
.
Disclosure: ASICS sent these shoes to review so I did not have to pay for them. No one is paying to make this video or to include their brand in this video. No one previewed this before it published.

title: New York Marathon 2024 - A Runner's Weekend
description:
The World Major Marathon season always ends on the first Sunday in November. It’s the most challenging course of the series, but the crowd support is unmatched. It’s my favorite race for chasing the pros and finding my friends. So let’s hop on a plane and head east. This is a runner’s weekend at the New York Marathon

0:00 intro
1:06 Under Armour
2:17 Running with Drew
3:30 Endorphins
4:15 Craft
5:01 Runna Shakeout
7:42 Coffee Club
8:39 On shoemaker robot
9:24 Bandit Running
10:33 New York Marathon 2024
13:57 Magic 
15:28 Final Finishers

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

If you want to watch my New York Marathon 2024 race video:
https://youtu.be/qJdUM4y5VyA?si=XTyRYTRALSuFkjFv

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

title: On Cloudboom Strike LS
description:
I got a chance to check out the On shoemaker robot while in New York. The thing really can make a shoe in 3 minutes (it sprays, paints, and cures the upper onto a pre-assembled midsole+outsole. 
.
On sent me home with a pair of the shoes (note: the shoes I have were not the ones that I saw being made), and I took them for a speed workout. For paces from mile to threshold, the shoe was more than up to the task. The faster you go, the smoother the ride is. 
.
The foam, which is 40% bio-based Helion HF, reminds me a bit of the Adios Pro 1. And the change in the clouds in the Cloudboom Strike LS. S the regular Cloudboom Strike is noticeable and welcome. Overall, it’s a bit on the firm side,  it there is a really nice sense of pop and ping. 
.
The upper is snug, but not as snug as you’d think. There’s more room in the toes than average for a racing shoe. Instead, I’m feeling g tightness across the widest part of my feet along the base of my toes. 
.
Getting into the shoe takes a bit of work, but it’s easier to get into than some of my other favorite racing shoes. The lack of laces didn’t give me any issues on turns and tangents. The upper is not fragile as you might think. 
.
Further testing is necessary. I’d love to get in a long run with some marathon effort miles to get a better sense of what this shoe is like for its intended purpose. 
.
Disclosures: On provided the shoe for me to review. They are not paying me to make this video and have no editorial review or control. I was able to view the shoemaker robot at On’s New York City popup at an event that was free and open to the public.

title: NYC Marathon 2024
description:
The women’s race delivered, giving us the Obiri/Lokedi duel we’d been hoping for, although it didn’t quite last as long as we’d hoped with Lokedi fading towards the end. Instead, Sheila Chepkirui was the one who took the mantle of racing Obiri stride for stride and elbow for elbow. In the end, Chepkirui had a bit more kick and secured her first New York title. 
.
The American women also performed quite well. I had predicted that Jess McClain would have a great day, which she did by coming in 8th overall as 2nd American. She was nudged out by last minute addition, Sara Vaughn, who had DNF’d in Chicago just a few weeks ago. I felt like Sara Vaughn finally got that solid marathon result that she’s been looking for in the past several builds, as did Kellyn Taylor, who came in 10th as the third American.
.
📹 Kofuzi, @chaseflemingphoto

title: New York Marathon 2024 Mens
description:
Perfect weather conditions led to an exciting race for the men, with Abdi Nageeye finally gets his NY win, beating Evans Chebet (2022 champion), Albert Korir (2021 champion), Tamirat Tola (2023 champion), and Geoffrey Kamworor (2017 and 2019 champion).
Americans had a good showing with three in the top ten (Conner Mantz 6, Clayton Young 7, CJ Albertson 10). Rory Linkletter led the charge for the Canadians with a 15th overall finish
.
📹Kofuzi, @chaseflemingphoto

title: Adidas Evo SL
description:
One of the promises of the Adios Pro Evo 1 is that the learnings from this ridiculously priced shoe would trickle down into Adidas mainstream product. We’ve seen some of the that promise fulfilled in the recently announced Adios Pro 4. And now, even more of that lineage is making its way into every day product. This is the Adizero Evo SL, and it’s time to take it for a run. 

0:00 intro
0:58 disclsoures
1:19 specs
5:02 what's it like
8:26 Adidas 2025
12:00 buying guide 
12:59 vs Pegasus Plus
14:02 vs Rebel v4

disclosures: Adidas provided these shoes, so I did not have to pay for them. No one is paying me to make this video or to include their shoe in this video. No one will get a chance to preview any of my footage or my thoughts before this video goes up on YouTube.

title: An expensive run
description:
I can’t tell if these workouts are too hard or if maybe this is just what hard workouts feel like at my age now. I hit some of the paces. But I had to go to basically max HR to get there. And I’m worried that this was too expensive of a price to pay for what I want to get later. 
.
Disclosures: I’m partnering with Runna on my buildup to the half marathon in Houston. I have a set list of deliverables on this partnership. This doesn’t fall within that specific set, so I’m not technically getting paid for this. but I’m gonna mark this as a sponsored post anyway.

title: ASICS Metaspeed Sky Paris After 100 Miles
description:
John Korir just ran the 5th fastest Marathon time ever on the streets of Chicago in a Metaspeed Sky prototype. But I think it still may be a while before that shoe makes it to the public. So in the meantime, let’s take a look at the current Metaspeed Sky Paris and see how my pair has held up over the last 100 miles. 

0:00 intro
0:46 disclosures
1:10 how I've been using them
3:08 how they've been holding up
6:57 ASICS explained
11:00 Buying Guide
12:13 vs Alphafly 3
15:00 vs Fast R2
16:36 vs Metaspeed Sky Plus

disclosures: ASICS provided these shoes to review. No one paid me to make this video or to include their shoe in this video. No one will get a chance to preview my footage or my thoughts before this video goes up on YouTube. 

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

Running footage shot on: 
GoPro Hero 13 (paid link) 
https://amzn.to/4dksfCn

Music sourced via Epidemic Sound https://www.epidemicsound.com/referral/0xronu/

Disclosure: It's 2024, so I think we all know how affiliate links work at this point, but for regulatory compliance or affiliate program purposes, I must state that affiliate links do not increase cost to you, but:
"As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases.” 

Also, you do not need to use these links. You can also search for these same items in amazon or on any search engine/shopping site of your choice and buy/research them that way. 
---

-------
strava: https://www.strava.com/athletes/kofuzi
instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kofuzi/
threads: https://www.threads.net/@kofuzi

subscriber count at time of upload: 200, 131

end card music:
Jim Yosef - Checkered
https://soundcloud.com/ninety9live/jim-yosef-checkered

title: Under Armour Infinite Elite
description:
To be very honest, I will admit that every time I hear about a new Under Armour athlete signing, I really wonder what the heck are they going to do all their daily training in. But now, there seems to be a bit of an answer. This is the Under Armour Infinite Elite, and it’s time to take it for a run.

0:00 intro
0:45 disclosures
1:06 Specs
3:51 What's It Like
7:15 Under Armour Explained
10:06 Buying Guide
10:46 vs Triumph 20, 21
12:01 vs Ultraboost 5X

disclosures: Under Armour provided these shoes for review. No one is paying me for this video or to include their shoe in this video. No one will get a chance to preview any of my footage or my thoughts before this video goes up on YouTube.

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

Running footage shot on: 
GoPro Hero 13 (paid link) 
https://amzn.to/4dksfCn

Music sourced via Epidemic Sound https://www.epidemicsound.com/referral/0xronu/

Disclosure: It's 2024, so I think we all know how affiliate links work at this point, but for regulatory compliance or affiliate program purposes, I must state that affiliate links do not increase cost to you, but:
"As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases.” 

Also, you do not need to use these links. You can also search for these same items in amazon or on any search engine/shopping site of your choice and buy/research them that way. 
---

-------
strava: https://www.strava.com/athletes/kofuzi
instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kofuzi/
threads: https://www.threads.net/@kofuzi

subscriber count at time of upload: 199,909

end card music:
Jim Yosef - Checkered
https://soundcloud.com/ninety9live/jim-yosef-checkered

shoe that I think we should take a look
at is the shoe that I always compare the
Triumph against because it's another
shoe that has beaded Foams as one of the
first shoes to use beaded Foams that's
from Adidas and that's the ultra boost
this is the ultra boost 5x and it's got
a different formulation of boost this
time it's got light boost in it which is
a lighter formulation of the regular
boost material that initially made the
ultra boost line so popular now the
light boost material as the name implies
makes the foam a little bit lighter but
I also feel like it's got a little bit
less rebound to it it's a little softer
and a little bit mushier which for a
shoe that's called Ultra boost and is
kind of in that Max cushion category I
feel like that's the right move and
progress for that shoe so if you want

say go with the ultra boost it is going

title: Adidas Evo SL
description:
First run in the all-lightstrike, no rods do-it-all from Adidas. The shoe certainly has that aggressive rocker of its bigger sibling, but the difference in foams make the SL version of the Evo a versatile shoe that can handle everything a daily trainer can do and then some. 
.
I only had a short run with some strides on the calendar, but so far, I’m loving what I’ve experienced. I would like to take it out for a fartlek or other light workout to see how it fares at speed for longer periods. But this very well could be the Peg Turbo or Rebel that I’ve been waiting for. 
.
Testing continues, and I’m trying not to get ahead of myself after just an hour in the shoe, but I suspect that the Evo SL is going to be challenging a lot top dogs in a variety of categories. 
.
Also, it’ll be just $150 
.
Disclosures: I received these shoes from Adidas to review. No one is paying me to make this video. No one previewed or had approval rights to this video. No brands have been tagged in this post, nor am I sending this video to any brand. 
.
Hat: Soar. I have done paid public appearance work for this brand. 
Shirt Adidas: I have done paid public appearance work for this brand, although I believe I bought this particular shirt myself. 
Half tights: Kofuzi Run Club collab merch
Socks: swiftwick. I have received product from this brand 
.
#runningshoes #evoSL

title: Chicago Marathon 2024 - A Runner's Weekend
description:
I’ve been flying all over the world to enjoy racing and the running community. Now, it’s time for me to play host and welcome everyone to my home turf. So it’s time to hop on the el and head to the loop. This is a runner’s weekend at the Chicago Marathon. 

0:00 intro
0:35 expo
3:00 speaking at Expo with Lindsay Hein
4:16 Industry Social Hour
5:36 Friday dinner
6:01 picking up media credentials
7:54 Tracksmith popup
8:42 Bandit popup
10:40 solo run Friday
12:49 Rabbit shakeout
14:49 ASICS x Fleetfeet shakeout
18:46 On store
20:15 PYNRS popup
22:27 solo run Saturday
22:53 Ali on the Run live show
24:16 Saturday dinner
25:14 pre-race
26:04 race start
26:34 mile 1.5
27:04 mile 2.5
28:43 mile 13
30:01 mile 17
30:49 mile 18
31:51 finish line
35:19 non elites 

Special thanks to my videographer for the weekend, Chase Fleming. Without his work, this video would not have been possible. Thanks also to those who contributed footage from parts of the course that I couldn’t get to. 
Chase Fleming https://www.chaseflemingphoto.com
Jon Kerzman mile 13.5
Luke Talbot mile 25 https://www.youtube.com/c/LukeTalbot3
- 
If you want to listen to the interview of me and Lindsey Hein
https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/relay/id1699044011?i=1000673311389
-
UPDATE: I’ll be doing a shakeout run before NYC Marathon. Saturday November 2 at 8am with Runna. RSVP here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/official-runna-shakeout-nyc-tickets-1049457454497?utm_experiment=test_share_listing&aff=ebdsshios

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

title: Adidas Adizero Adios Pro 4
description:
This is the Adios Pro 4, and by the time it releases, it will have been two and a half years since this shoe has gotten an update. And while it’s certainly a stunning shoe, was it worth the wait? It’s time to lace up the Adios Pro 4, and take it for a run

0:00 intro
0:42 Disclosures
1:04 Specs
5:44 What’s It Like
9:54 Adidas Rotation
12:50 Buying Guide
13:40 vs Adios Pro Evo 1
14:12 vs Adios Pro 3
14:53 vs AF3

Disclosures: Adidas provided these shoes to review, however no one is paying me to make this video or to include their shoe in this video. No one will get a chance to preview any of my footage or my thoughts before this video goes up on YouTube. 

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

Running footage shot on: 
GoPro Hero 13 (paid link) 
https://amzn.to/4dksfCn

Music sourced via Epidemic Sound https://www.epidemicsound.com/referral/0xronu/

Disclosure: It's 2024, so I think we all know how affiliate links work at this point, but for regulatory compliance or affiliate program purposes, I must state that affiliate links do not increase cost to you, but:
"As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases.” 

Also, you do not need to use these links. You can also search for these same items in amazon or on any search engine/shopping site of your choice and buy/research them that way. 
---

-------

instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kofuzi/
threads: https://www.threads.net/@kofuzi

subscriber count at time of upload: 199,384

end card music:
Jim Yosef - Checkered
https://soundcloud.com/ninety9live/jim-yosef-checkered

title: Adidas Supernova Prima
description:
A cousin of the Supernova Rise, the extra cushion is a welcome addition to the family. I don’t get a feeling of extra sponginess or extra plushness (the regular Supernova Rise is plenty plush as it is), but the shoe is just more pleasant to run in for longer distances. It’s still not quite a max cushion shoe, imo. There’s just a bit more foam under the forefoot, which improves the experience. 
.
Disclosures: Adidas provided the shoes. They are not paying me to make this video. No one previewed this video before it published. I made it in the car on the way to my daughter’s cross country meet and uploaded it from the highway. 
.
Hat: Terrex. I have received product from this brand, although I bought this particular hat. 
Shirt, socks, and half tights: adidas. I have done paid public appearance work with this brand and have received product from this brand, but I did happen to buy the shirt. 
Sunglasses: goodr. I have received product from this brand. 
.
#runningshoes

title: MetaSpeed Sky Prototype
description:
Ok so I got some limited information about the shoes the ASICS athletes were wearing in Chicago. ASICS was willing to confirm that this was a Metaspeed Sky Prototype and share the following quote from Chicago Marathon Champion, John Korir:
.
“This is the best shoe I have run in. It’s much lighter, bouncier and more comfortable for marathon racing. It gave me a lot of confidence during the race on Sunday and I know it was a very important part of my success.”
.
I’ll be sitting down with some other ASICS athletes who I know tend to race in MetaSpeed Edge, so we’ll see if I can get further detail about whether there are similar updates for that shoe. 
.
#chicagomarathon #metaspeedsky #runningshoes

title: Brooks Glycerin Max
description:
When it comes to running shoes, softness is a deceptively complex feature. Previously, Brooks take on softness, for me personally, always felt so uncomfortably firm. But this is the all new Glycerin Max. With its new foam and bold design, will this be the max cushion brooks that I’ve been looking for? It’s time to lace up the Glycerin Max and take it for a run

0:00 intro
0:55 disclosures
1:12 specs
5:40 what’s it like
8:02 Brooks -Max shoes explained
10:37 buying guide
11:29 vs MagMax 
12:16 vs Superblast 2

Disclosures: FleetFeet provided these shoes for review, so I did not have to pay for them. No one is paying me to make this video or to include their shoe in this video. No one will have a chance to preview any of my footage or my thoughts before this video goes up on YouTube. Note that there are no affiliate links for any of the shoes mentioned in this video. It makes no financial difference to me how you get your shoes (although I'd always prefer if you support your local run specialty)

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

Running footage shot on: 
GoPro Hero 13 (paid link) 
https://amzn.to/4dksfCn

Music sourced via Epidemic Sound https://www.epidemicsound.com/referral/0xronu/

Disclosure: It's 2024, so I think we all know how affiliate links work at this point, but for regulatory compliance or affiliate program purposes, I must state that affiliate links do not increase cost to you, but:
"As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases.” 

Also, you do not need to use these links. You can also search for these same items in amazon or on any search engine/shopping site of your choice and buy/research them that way.

title: Chicago Marathon Champion
description:
Ruth Chepngetich wins her third championship in Chicago and sets the city on fire with a women’s marathon world record of 2:09:56. Chepngetich is the 2021 and 2022 Chicago Marathon champion, and in 2023, she came in second behind current Olympic champion Sifan Hassan. 
Chepngetich’s previous PR was from Chicago 2022, which was just seconds off the then world record that was also set in Chicago (Brigid Kosgei, 2019). 
.
Chicago is for runners 
.
📹 @chaseflemingphoto , Kofuzi
.
@chimarathon #chicagomarathon @ruthchepngetich94

title: Chicago Marathon 2024. Boys
description:
I wanted to cover the American women’s race, so my coverage of the men was limited. But I still had some fun out there looking for the men pros, pacers, and friends. 
.
Congratulations to John Korir for the breakaway win. I remember first meeting John a couple days before he won the LA Marathon in 2022. He was a tiny guy in a gigantic puffy coat, and he had the best smile I’d ever seen. 
.
The American men had a pretty good day with CJ and Zach working together for much of the race. Reed Fischer ran with grit for the 3rd American spot. 
.
Pacer Matt Centrowitz was all smiles as he came through the finishing chute, as was Rory Linkletter, who lost Annie Frisbie and (I think) decided to catch up to Lindsay Flanagan to assist her to a second American finish. 
.
Friend and fellow YouTuber Matt Fox also had a good day, finally hitting that elusive sub 2:20 mark.
.
#chicagomarathon

title: Chicago Marathon 2024. Pro Women
description:
pro women put on a show in Chicago. The American women were poised to attack the American record, but it was Ruth Chepngetich who demolished the already incredibly fast women’s WORLD record with a time of 2:09:56! And it was a doubly good day for Kenya with John Korir having a breakthrough performance to win decisively in the men’s side. 
Susanna Sullivan took the top spot amongst the American women, with Lindsay Flanagan and Emma Bates following behind. 
.
📹 chaseflemingphoto , Kofuzi 
.
#chicagomarathon #marathonrecord

title: On Cloudmonster Hyper - After 100 Miles
description:
On shoes have a tendency to start off strong for me but the love affair fade fast. I just lose interest. But after a summer of running, did the peba forefoot and no speedboard of these shoes help buck this trend? Let’s talk about the Cloudmonster Hyper, after 100 miles. 

0:00
0:56 intro
1:13 how I've been using them
2:38 how they've been holding up
4:56 On explained
9:27 Buying Guide
10:19 vs Skyward X
11:34 vs Triumph 22

disclosures: On sent me these shoes to review, so I did not have to pay for them. However, no one is paying me to make this video or to include their shoe in this video. No one will get a chance to preview any of my footage or my thoughts before this video goes up on YouTube. 

Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

Running footage shot on: 
GoPro Hero 13 (paid link) 
https://amzn.to/4dksfCn

Music sourced via Epidemic Sound https://www.epidemicsound.com/referral/0xronu/

Disclosure: It's 2024, so I think we all know how affiliate links work at this point, but for regulatory compliance or affiliate program purposes, I must state that affiliate links do not increase cost to you, but:
"As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases.” 

Also, you do not need to use these links. You can also search for these same items in amazon or on any search engine/shopping site of your choice and buy/research them that way.

title: Hoka Skyflow
description:
On paper, the Hoka Skyflow is intriguing with its supercritical EVA and Skyward X inspired geometry. But on foot, the Active Foot Frame made the whole thing feel like an old Clifton with a little bit of Arahi. Overall, it’s not bad. I was able to get into a pretty decent rhythm with it, and it’s one of those shoes that people will be swearing to me feels better after about 100 miles or so. But out of the box, the whole thing is a bit stiff and motion controlled. 
I think there’s certainly a market for this kind of shoe, and Hoka OG’s who don’t like the new Clifton may have their new champion. But at $160, I’m not sure why someone wouldn’t just reach for the Arahi at $145 instead. 
It is quite comfortable for walking though. 
.
Disclosures: Hoka sent this shoe for review, so I did not have to pay for it. No one is paying for this video or to be included in this video. 
Hat: Path Projects x Semi Rad collab. I have made merch with Path and Semi Rad once reposted something semi-nice I said about his book. 
Shirt and shorts: Ultimate Direction. I have received product from this brand. 
Sunglasses: Rudy Project. I have received product from this brand. 
Watch: Garmin. I have received product from this brand. 
Other watch: Apple. None. 
Earbuds: beats. None.

title: Puma MagMax
description:
This is the Puma Mag Max, and it’s got a double tall dose of nitro foam. Will it be the max cushion cruiser that the name implies? Or will this just be another big shoe that ends up being a bit too firm. It’s time to lace up the Mag Max and take it for a run. 

0:00 intro
0:55 Disclosures
1:13 Specs
3:38 What’s it Like
5:46 Puma Explained
7:46 Buying Guide
8:18 vs Glycerin Max
9:06 vs Glideride Max

disclosures: Puma sent these shoes to review, so I did not have to pay for them. However, no one is paying me to make this video or to include their shoe in this video. No one will get a chance to preview any of my footage or my thoughts before this video goes up on YouTube.


Thanks for watching! Leave a comment to let me know you stopped by!

Catch the livestream https://www.youtube.com/c/kofuzirunclub/

Running footage shot on: 
GoPro Hero 13 (paid link) 
https://amzn.to/4dksfCn

Music sourced via Epidemic Sound https://www.epidemicsound.com/referral/0xronu/

Disclosure: It's 2024, so I think we all know how affiliate links work at this point, but for regulatory compliance or affiliate program purposes, I must state that affiliate links do not increase cost to you, but:
"As an Amazon Associate I earn from qualifying purchases.” 

Also, you do not need to use these links. You can also search for these same items in amazon or on any search engine/shopping site of your choice and buy/research them that way. 
---

-------
strava: https://www.strava.com/athletes/kofuzi
instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kofuzi/
threads: https://www.threads.net/@kofuzi

subscriber count at time of upload: 198,274

end card music:
Jim Yosef - Checkered
https://soundcloud.com/ninety9live/jim-yosef-checkered
